item.title: Improving code quality - Session 43: Return of values
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ In the latest installment of ‚ÄúImproving Code Quality,‚Äù Munetoshi Ishikawa discusses the function for registering new users in the LINE app. üîß The registerNewUser function handles two main tasks: creating a user account and uploading a profile image. The process includes validating the account creation request and checking if the profile image is uploaded successfully. For more insights, check out the full article! #CodeQuality #SoftwareDevelopment #MobileApp #LINE #Programming

item.title: Improving code quality - Session 42: Theoretical testing
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üîç Session 42 of ‚ÄúImproving Code Quality‚Äù focuses on theoretical testing in mobile development. Munetoshi Ishikawa discusses how to manage different account types (FREE, PREMIUM, etc.) with icons. If AccountType is solely for UI, icons can be properties. However, for broader usage, a conversion mechanism using a Map is more effective. Explore efficient coding strategies! üíª‚ú® #CodeQuality #SoftwareDevelopment #MobileDev #Programming #TheoreticalTesting

item.title: Hack the planet! A recap of Hack Day 2025
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Just wrapped up Hack Day 2025 at LY Corporation in Tokyo! This internal hackathon, running since 2007, allows employees from all departments to collaborate freely on projects. Teams can be formed locally or globally, fostering creativity and innovation. üôå Participants shared ideas, planned, and developed products over two days, with a focus on collaboration and fun. Stay tuned for more insights from the concurrent Tech-Verse conference! #HackDay2025 #Innovation #Teamwork #LYCorporation‚Ä¶
